What to do in case of  a poisonous snake or cobra bite
✱  Since the poison can spread through the blood, the person should not be 
moved.
✱  The body part, which was bitten, should be kept in a lower position than the heart. 
✱  A tight cloth or bandage can be tied tightly  just above the bite to slow down the blood flow towards the heart. This can even save the life of a person.
✱  The person should be taken to a hospital immediately for an anti-venom injection.
Road Accidents   
Common causes of road accidents are:
a. Fast-moving vehicles 
b. People running across the road or on the edge of the road
c. Animals that wander along the road
d. Roads in a bad condition
e. Insufficient road lighting; traffic signals not working properly 
f. Traffic rules violations
g. Drunk driving
h. Using mobile phone while driving
✱  Vehicle should be driven only at the age legally permitted.
